Procedure/Site: Rectal approach: Insert hand into rectum, palpate lesser sciatic foramen, guide needle externally at ischiorectal fossa.
Purpose/Use: Used in bulls for penile surgeries, 20–25 ml local anaesthetic per side.

Procedure/Site: Insert needle between the zygomatic arch and coronoid process into the pterygopalatine fossa.
Purpose/Use: Blocks cranial nerves for enucleation or eye surgeries in cattle.

Procedure/Site: Inject at the dorsal zygomatic arch (just caudal to lateral canthus of the eye).
Purpose/Use: Prevents blinking for eye examination/surgery, no analgesia.

Procedure/Site: Palpate supraorbital foramen (above medial canthus), inject 2–5 ml local anaesthetic.
Purpose/Use: Desensitizes upper eyelid in large animals.

Procedure/Site: Insert needle into infraorbital foramen (above 3rd upper premolar).
Purpose/Use: Desensitizes upper lip, nose, and upper incisors.

Procedure/Site: Insert needle medial to mandible, below last molar toward mandibular foramen.
Purpose/Use: Desensitizes lower jaw, teeth, and lips.

Procedure/Site: Inject 5–10 ml local anaesthetic halfway between lateral canthus and horn base (along temporal line).
Insert needle at level of shoulder joint (medial to scapula), advance cranially under scapula.
Ring block above the fetlock joint, inject on both medial and lateral aspects.
Purpose/Use: Used for hoof surgeries, lameness diagnosis.
